title: gradechecklists
introduction: In this guide, weâ€™ll show you how to grade Cornerstone checklists. Lippincott checklists follow a different process.

steps.title: Access Grade Checklist Page
steps.details:
1. To begin, click the menu icon.
  2. Under the Learning dropdown, click on Grade Checklists.

steps.title: Find Checklist to Grade
steps.details:
1. Filter the list of all outstanding checklists by entering learner name, ID, and/or checklist title.
  2. Click the search button.
  3. Click on the checklist title for the learner you are trying to grade.

steps.title: Grading Checklist Item
steps.details:
1. For each item observed, select the correct date and rating of the item.
  2. When you are finished, check the box next to the item to mark it complete.

steps.title: Adding Observation Notes
steps.details:
1. Click on the Observation Notes button at the top of the checklist.
  2. Type in any notes you wish to make.
  3. If you do want the employee to see the note, uncheck the hide note from employee checkbox.
  4. Click the Post button.
  5. Click the Back button to return to the checklist when finished.

steps.title: Sign off Checklist
steps.details:
Once all items have been graded in the checklist and marked complete, you can then sign it off.

  1. Click Sign at the bottom of the checklist and it will populate your signature and mark the date it was signed.

The history section will also appear below, stating when the checklist was signed and by whom.

The sign option won't be available until all items have been graded with a check mark.

Most checklists will require the manager to approve the checklist completion after it's been signed by the preceptor.
